reviews.review_text: Rating: 8.5/10 Status: Awesome    What is it   Ms Splosion Man is a precision based platformer that will test you skills.  The Good: + 45+ Single player and Multiplayer levels + Great variety in each level, you will splode off speed barrels, regular barrels, timed walls, moving platforms, ride rocket cards and zip on railings. The developers made sure that every level provides something fresh to test your platforming skills + Great challenge, each level introducing new concepts and builds upon it through out the game. The first few levels are easy but as you move further along things become increasingly difficult + Lots of good platforming puzzles in each level, good satisfaction when you figure out what you have to do.  + Great artwork and graphics  + Lots of Arnold Schwarzenegger movie references  + Possibly one of the strangest endings in video game history.   The Bad: - Multiplayer community is dead so you won't be able to play any of the multiplayer levels. Their is a mode however that lets you play with one controller however this is very frustrating and is not the way the levels were meant to be played, still it was nice of the developers to include it - The game can and will be frustrating at times, this isn't necessarily a bad point against the game per se but if your a gamer who gets frustrating easily, you may want to avoid this game.   Conclusion: I loved this game and if you have the patience you will too. One of the best platforming games around.

This is a tough, but fun platformer. Its funny, and enjoyable. You can play a few minutes each day and be done with it. There's no need to play for hours at a time.  You can replay levels, there's a multiplayer option, which I haven't tried. There's separate endings for single and multiplayer.  It does use GFWL, I hope it gets patched out before GFWL is shut down in July.  I purchased it for a bit over $2 and have it on the XBOX 360 as well *won it in a McDonald's promo.*  It's not as hard as Super Meat Boy, but it is hard. It has checkpoints in the game though.  If you like hard platformer games and have a wicked sense of humor, its worth buying.
A quirky peice of fun which manages to be a comical romp and a great platformer to boot. Did I mention it has CO OP also?  5/5 would splode again.

A great humourous side scrolling action platform puzzle game, similar to classic sonic in many ways  Apparently this game used to be pretty buggy and crash, Twisted pixel have recently been active on the forums and patched this issue and have also stated that they are removing the Games For Windows Live wrapping too.  Outside of GFWL nonsense I have experieinced no issues with this game.

If you love games like Donkey Kong Country or Rayman Origins/Legends, then Ms. Splosion man is worth your time!  Pros: - Can be very challenging and somewhat rewarding when you get things going - Puzzle elements are fun - Lots of levels  Cons: - Sometimes it feels like you've died a bit cheaply - End game doesn't really offer anything new apart from challenging levels - could've offered something like upgrade able abilities or more techniques to solve puzzles - Secret exits are cool, but it's annoying you have to go back through the same level where you found the exit to continue on  Game can drag a little bit towards the end, but it's a good platformer!
great co op game if you dont have an idiot who is your partner

This game is a blast. I'm really picky about platformers, especially when they're ported over from consoles, but this one is well done. It's not troublesome at all to play with a keyboard. The game is also loaded with extras that are hilarious at times.

This is a great platforming game.  There were many things I didn't like about it. The menu system is awkward, especially on the PC. The female-stereotypical (i.e.: sexist) humor was kind of disgusting, even if it was deliberate. And the boss battles were dull.  But the levels themselves are very well made. They are varied enough to not be boring, and the difficulty is just right (not Super Meat Boy hard, but hard enough).  If you grew up playing Super Mario Bros. and have a hard time finding decent modern platforming games, you should give this one a try.  8/10.
Love the sequel, just wish they had the originial 'Splosion Man on steam. :(

Ms Splosion Man is not a bad game, far from it. It never reached a point where it was explicitly bad, but unless you've beaten every other platformer under the sun. Your money is better spent elsewhere. The gameplay can't compare to the sheer number out there today. Also, the humor is funny during the intro and ending, in-between it's just obnoxious. I recommend muting and playing your own music over it.
Hmm. It's got a style. The gameplay is hard, but not unfair. I just can't help but wonder, if I was female, would I be offended by this?

Hmmmm, Games for Windows Live, I thought that parasitic bit of junk was dead and lifeless but NO you have to use it to play this game....aaaaarrrgghh! What were they thinking?!  The game's okay, it really would be better if I'd used a 360 controller but via a keyboard it did work albeit less than ideal. However, the GfWL addition is enough to make me feel as if I'll never return to it and sooner or later will 'delete local content'.  Shame.
